name: glkvm-cloud
readme_summary: GLKVM Cloud is a self-hosted, lightweight KVM remote management platform designed for individuals and small businesses. It offers secure remote access, device management, and batch operations, built upon the rttys project for rapid deployment and full data control.
primary_use_case: To provide a secure, self-hosted, and easy-to-deploy remote management platform for KVM devices, suitable for individuals and small businesses.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled technician, depicted as a meticulous clockmaker, is assembling and fine-tuning a complex, miniature KVM device that glows with a soft, secure blue light. Gears and intricate clockwork mechanisms represent the underlying technology, while a magnifying glass reveals a small, clear digital interface showing device status and remote control options. The technician is carefully connecting data streams represented by glowing fiber optic cables, ensuring seamless and secure remote access. The background is a clean, organized workshop with subtle digital circuit patterns. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on precision and security, using a palette of blues, grays, and subtle metallic accents.

name: TempFastMail
description: Self Hosted Temporary Fast Email Box
readme_summary: TempFastMail is a self-hosted, disposable email inbox solution built with PHP and React. It allows users to quickly set up a temporary email address to receive and view messages, with automatic deletion after 48 hours for privacy.
primary_use_case: Providing a temporary, self-hosted email inbox for receiving messages without long-term storage, ideal for sign-ups or testing purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, magical mailbox that instantly receives letters and displays their contents on a floating, translucent screen before the letters gently dissolve into digital dust. The mailbox has a subtle 'TempFastMail' logo etched onto it. In the background, a small, stylized server rack hums with soft blue light, and a few lines of code are faintly visible on a nearby digital tablet. The scene is set in a clean, minimalist digital space with soft, ambient lighting, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant, friendly colors, emphasizing the ephemeral nature of the received emails.

name: firefly-iii
description: Firefly III: a personal finances manager
readme_summary: Firefly III is a self-hosted personal finance manager designed to help users track income and expenses, manage budgets, and gain insight into their financial habits. It provides tools for budgeting, categorization, tagging, and offers various financial reports, all while ensuring user data privacy and control.
key_features: Self-hosted and isolated, no external server contact unless explicitly configured.
REST JSON API for extensive programmatic control.
primary_use_case: To provide individuals with a comprehensive, self-hosted tool for managing personal finances, enabling better budgeting, expense tracking, and financial insight.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old owl perched on a stack of ledgers, meticulously sorting glowing coins into different labeled jars representing income, expenses, savings, and budgets. The owl uses a magnifying glass to examine each coin, symbolizing detailed tracking. Subtle digital particles flow from the ledgers to the jars, indicating data processing. In the background, a faint blueprint of a secure vault is visible, representing self-hosting and data security. The scene is bathed in a warm, ambient light, conveying financial clarity and control. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with clean lines and a soft color palette, featuring the Firefly III logo subtly integrated into one of the jars.

name: pageindex-mcp
description: MCP server for PageIndex. PageIndex is a vectorless reasoning-based RAG system which uses multi-step reasoning and tree search to retrieve information like a human expert would.
readme_summary: PageIndex MCP is a server that exposes PageIndex, a vectorless, reasoning-based RAG system, directly to LLMs and agents. It allows platforms like Claude and Cursor to interact with document structure via tree indexing, eliminating the need for vector databases and enabling human-like information retrieval from long documents.
key_features: LLM-native, in-context tree index via MCP
Preserves full document context and structure
primary_use_case: Enabling LLM-based applications to perform advanced information retrieval and reasoning over documents without relying on traditional vector databases, by exposing a structured, tree-based index through the MCP protocol.
cover_image_prompt: A wise, old librarian meticulously organizing a vast, ancient library where books are represented as intricate, glowing tree structures. The librarian is using a magnifying glass to trace a path through the branches of a tree, symbolizing multi-step reasoning and tree search. Instead of vectors, glowing lines connect related concepts within the trees. In the background, subtle digital interfaces show the repository name 'PageIndex MCP' and abstract representations of document structures. The scene is bathed in warm, intellectual light, rendered in a detailed, 3D isometric illustration style, emphasizing clarity and depth.

name: NetScan-Pro
description: An interactive Bash-based network scanning tool that provides live host discovery, port scanning, traceroute, and ping tests, featuring visually appealing ASCII banners and fun messages.
readme_summary: NetScan Pro is an interactive Bash-based network scanning tool that offers live host discovery, port scanning, traceroute, and ping tests. It is designed for network administrators and security professionals, providing a user-friendly interface with colorful outputs and visual elements for network reconnaissance and security assessment.
key_features: Network Discovery (Live host detection, device enumeration, gateway/subnet mapping)
Wireless Network Analysis (Wi-Fi discovery, signal strength)
primary_use_case: Network reconnaissance and security assessment for administrators and professionals.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant network administrator, depicted as a modern-day cartographer, meticulously drawing a detailed map of a digital landscape. Instead of traditional tools, they use a glowing tablet displaying network nodes and connections. The map itself is a vibrant, interconnected web of data streams, with some nodes highlighted in red (indicating potential vulnerabilities) and others in green (secure hosts). Small, subtle icons representing nmap, traceroute, and Wi-Fi symbols float around the scene. The overall mood is one of focused discovery and security. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, futuristic aesthetic and a color palette of blues, greens, and subtle reds.
